law.catch_line: Contracts for assistance with governments, governmental agencies and others -- Operations in adjoining states.
law.text: The board of directors may enter into contracts or other arrangements with the United States government or any department thereof, with persons and public corporations, with the government of this or any other state and with sewerage, drainage, conservation, conservancy or other improvement districts in this or any other state, for cooperation or assistance in constructing, maintaining, using and operating the works of the district or the waters thereof, or for making surveys and investigations or reports thereon. The board may purchase, lease or acquire land or other property in adjoining states in order to secure outlets or for other purposes of KRS 220.010 to 220.520, and may let contracts or spend money for securing such outlets or other works in adjoining states.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2062g-36.
